intro: Tithymalus basarabicus, commonly known as the Basarab's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
